snippet: Clashes erupted in parts of western India on Saturday as the police detained the popular leader of a well-to-do caste group that is fighting India’s entrenched quota system.
abstract: Thousands of supporters block roads and hold sit-ins in Ahmedabad, India, to protest detention of Hardik Patel, popular leader of nation's privileged Patidar caste;  Patel had been organizing demonstrations against 65-year-old affirmative action rules that reserve government jobs and public college slots for disadvantaged Indian castes or tribes.
lead_paragraph: Clashes erupted in parts of western India on Saturday as the police detained the popular leader of a well-to-do caste group that is fighting India’s entrenched quota system.

headline.main: Leader of Protests Against Caste Quotas in India Is Detained
headline.print_headline: Leader of Protests Against Caste Quotas in India Is Detained
